msg: Why does my submitted ticket keep showing 'In Progress'? It's been 3 days, and I can't see any admin replies in the system at all. Is there a problem with the backend?

I've had the same issue! The after-sales ticket I submitted was stuck for two days last time. I contacted customer service and found out it was because the system cache wasn't cleared. Try refreshing the page or logging out and back in?

We apologize for the inconvenience! After investigation, there was a delay in the status synchronization interface for some tickets. Our technical team has urgently fixed the issue, and now all ticket statuses can be updated in real-time. Your ticket has been prioritized, and the reply will be synced to the system notification—please keep an eye on it~
Great! I refreshed the page and saw the admin's reply right away. The problem was resolved quickly, thank you so much!

Can we add an 'Attachment Upload' feature to the ticket submission form? Every time I report an issue, I have to describe it manually without being able to upload screenshots—it's really inconvenient.

Second this strongly! Especially when encountering interface bugs, it's hard to explain clearly with just text, and admins can't locate the problem quickly. Adding an attachment feature is definitely necessary.

Thank you both for your valuable feedback! The 'Attachment Upload' feature has been added to our development plan and will be launched in next week's version update~ It will support uploading images, documents, etc., with a size limit of 20MB, making it easier for everyone to report issues efficiently.
Awesome! It will be much more convenient to report issues from now on. Looking forward to the new version!
Could someone tell me how to view my previously submitted historical tickets? I've looked everywhere but can't find the entry—am I doing something wrong?

I couldn't find it at first either! Later I found out it's in the 'Personal Center'—click in and there's an option for 'My Tickets' where all historical records are stored, and you can also check the processing progress.

Thanks to User F for the helpful answer~ To add: besides 'Personal Center → My Tickets', the 'Ticket Query' entry on the homepage also allows you to search historical records by phone number or order number. We will add this operation prompt to the newbie guide to help more users get started quickly~
Got it! I'll try that right away. Thank you to the admin and this friend!
When I log in with a sub-account to submit a ticket, the system prompts 'No submission permission'. The main account clearly said they had authorized me—what's going on?

I ran into this situation before! It's because the main account only enabled 'View Permission' but not 'Submission Permission' when setting up permissions. Ask the main account to reconfigure it in the backend.

That's correct! For sub-account ticket operation permissions, the main account needs to check specific permission items such as 'Submit Ticket' and 'View Ticket' in 'Team Management → Permission Settings'. If the permission prompt still appears after configuration, please contact customer service with your account information, and we will assist in troubleshooting~
Okay! I'll ask the main account to adjust the settings. Thanks everyone for the help!
